stories.fullText: Sorry about that, ChatGPT doesn‚Äôt really work that well on stuff like this, well it does initially but soon enough it‚Äôs just not that effective. The first thing I did with ChatGPT was try to stimulate like a friend and it just wasn‚Äôt the best at it, over time, some people have good recommendations to make it remember convos so you should probably try that. I personally vent online to randoms, it‚Äôs better than nothing. I‚Äôm really sorry this happened to you, it probably really does suck to lose something that can at least give the impression of understanding you, maybe there will be a new plug-in soon enough to make this stuff better

stories.fullText:
I genuinely think that what you experienced before it shut down is gonna be the default condition of the vast majority of human beings from now on.

As Time will pass, machines will be more and more adapted to your very own self, knowing you far better than you know yourself. They will end up being our only Friend, confident, psychologist, lover, inspiration, interaction.

You should consider lucky that This conversation came to an end because there will be a point where most of these kind of conversations will stop ending. And that will be the very beggining of the true end of the human race as a whole.

I'm not being sarcastic. This subject is extremely concerning.

stories.fullText:
feel free to copy the relevant parts of the conversation into a new chat, and tell it to concisely summarize the information.

Then, copy and paste that into a new chat.

Or, you can do that with the entire chat. Start with the first bunch of messages, then continue on from there, with the first summary + remaining messages, etc.

stories.fullText: I fear rising generations will probably end up so reliant on it that they won't internalize many things and will just know enough to figure out how to ask the right questions.  This last week it went down and I had 4 hours I had to familiarize myself with the code that was working so I could change it to do something more. It was kinda stressful having to rely on my internal brain again.

stories.fullText:
Willing to preemptively bet before doing any research that because as an AI, it's unable to pick apart the *important* things to remember about its conversation, it basically incorporates every single previous message into the calculation, meaning that a conversation's computational requirements are exponential in nature.

Like others have mentioned, some way to parse the log for the important bits, wipe everything by starting a new conversation, and then feed it back the summarized important bits, it can be made more similar to a normal person in that they're both able to hold a conversation and also forget the older parts of it.

Obviously going to have a few differences, and something important is lost in that summary, but the human mind is far more dense than computers, and costs a whole lot more than you're paying, too.
